page.title: 18YOXALL_HISTORY & BUILDINGS
page.content: The manor was given by the 2nd Earl of Lancaster to his favourite,Robert Holland who later betrayed his patron. After the battle of Burton Bridge in 1322 the "Friends of the Earl of Lancaster" razed the manor house to the ground.The manor then passed through the hands of the Lovell family,King Henry V11 and the Fitzwilliam family.In 1539 it went to the Hollys, then to the Pagets, then the Stoneleigh family held it until 1923 when the manorial system was wound up.Opposite The Moat is The Court House dating from 16th C and probably the gate house to the manor of that time. According to tradition it was the venue of the manor court. Cornmill House next door to The Moat was built early 19th C.The watermill has been demolished.The bridge over the Swarbourn was built in 1813.
